trans-unit.source: Set up a SQL Server virtual machine as an IPython Notebook server | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Set up a SQL Server virtual machine as an IPython Notebook server | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Set up a Data Science Virtual Machine with SQL Server and IPython Server.
trans-unit.target: Set up a Data Science Virtual Machine with SQL Server and IPython Server.

trans-unit.source: This topic shows how to provision and configure an SQL Server virtual machine to be used as part of a cloud-based data science environment.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows how to provision and configure an SQL Server virtual machine to be used as part of a cloud-based data science environment.

trans-unit.source: The Windows virtual machine is configured with supporting tools such as IPython Notebook, Azure Storage Explorer and AzCopy, as well as other utilities that are useful for data science projects.
trans-unit.target: The Windows virtual machine is configured with supporting tools such as IPython Notebook, Azure Storage Explorer and AzCopy, as well as other utilities that are useful for data science projects.

trans-unit.source: Azure Storage Explorer and AzCopy, for example, provide convenient ways to upload data to Azure blob storage from your local machine or to download it to your local machine from blob storage.
trans-unit.target: Azure Storage Explorer and AzCopy, for example, provide convenient ways to upload data to Azure blob storage from your local machine or to download it to your local machine from blob storage.

trans-unit.source: The Azure virtual machine gallery includes several images that contain Microsoft SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: The Azure virtual machine gallery includes several images that contain Microsoft SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: Select an SQL Server VM image that is suitable for your data needs.
trans-unit.target: Select an SQL Server VM image that is suitable for your data needs.

trans-unit.source: Recommended images are:
trans-unit.target: Recommended images are:

trans-unit.source: SQL Server 2012 SP2 Enterprise for small to medium data sizes
trans-unit.target: SQL Server 2012 SP2 Enterprise for small to medium data sizes

trans-unit.source: SQL Server 2012 SP2 Enterprise Optimized for DataWarehousing Workloads for large to very large data sizes
trans-unit.target: SQL Server 2012 SP2 Enterprise Optimized for DataWarehousing Workloads for large to very large data sizes

trans-unit.source: SQL Server 2012 SP2 Enterprise image does not include a data disk.
trans-unit.target: SQL Server 2012 SP2 Enterprise image does not include a data disk.

trans-unit.source: You will need to add and/or attach one or more virtual hard disks to store your data.
trans-unit.target: You will need to add and/or attach one or more virtual hard disks to store your data.

trans-unit.source: When you create an Azure virtual machine, it has a disk for the operating system mapped to the C drive and a temporary disk mapped to the D drive.
trans-unit.target: When you create an Azure virtual machine, it has a disk for the operating system mapped to the C drive and a temporary disk mapped to the D drive.

trans-unit.source: Do not use the D drive to store data.
trans-unit.target: Do not use the D drive to store data.

trans-unit.source: As the name implies, it provides temporary storage only.
trans-unit.target: As the name implies, it provides temporary storage only.

trans-unit.source: It offers no redundancy or backup because it doesn't reside in Azure storage.
trans-unit.target: It offers no redundancy or backup because it doesn't reside in Azure storage.

trans-unit.source: Log in to the <linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title> using your account.
trans-unit.target: Log in to the <linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title> using your account.

trans-unit.source: If you do not have an Azure account, visit <linkText>Azure free trial</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you do not have an Azure account, visit <linkText>Azure free trial</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure Management Portal, at the bottom left of the web page, click +NEW, click COMPUTE, click VIRTUAL MACHINE, and then click FROM GALLERY.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure Management Portal, at the bottom left of the web page, click +NEW, click COMPUTE, click VIRTUAL MACHINE, and then click FROM GALLERY.

trans-unit.source: On the Create a Virtual Machine page, select a virtual machine image containing SQL Server based on your data needs, and then click the next arrow at the bottom right of the page.
trans-unit.target: On the Create a Virtual Machine page, select a virtual machine image containing SQL Server based on your data needs, and then click the next arrow at the bottom right of the page.

trans-unit.source: For the most up-to-date information on the supported SQL Server images on Azure, see <linkText>Getting Started with SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title> topic in the <linkText>SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title> documentation set.
trans-unit.target: For the most up-to-date information on the supported SQL Server images on Azure, see <linkText>Getting Started with SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title> topic in the <linkText>SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title> documentation set.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Select SQL Server VM</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Select SQL Server VM</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the first Virtual Machine Configuration page, provide the following information:
trans-unit.target: On the first Virtual Machine Configuration page, provide the following information:

trans-unit.source: Provide a VIRTUAL MACHINE NAME.
trans-unit.target: Provide a VIRTUAL MACHINE NAME.

trans-unit.source: In the NEW USER NAME box, type unique user name for the VM local administrator account.
trans-unit.target: In the NEW USER NAME box, type unique user name for the VM local administrator account.

trans-unit.source: In the NEW PASSWORD box, type a strong password.
trans-unit.target: In the NEW PASSWORD box, type a strong password.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Strong Passwords</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Strong Passwords</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In the CONFIRM PASSWORD box, retype the password.
trans-unit.target: In the CONFIRM PASSWORD box, retype the password.

trans-unit.source: Select the appropriate SIZE from the drop down list.
trans-unit.target: Select the appropriate SIZE from the drop down list.

trans-unit.source: The size of the virtual machine is specified during provisioning: A2 is the smallest size recommended for production workloads.
trans-unit.target: The size of the virtual machine is specified during provisioning: A2 is the smallest size recommended for production workloads.

trans-unit.source: The minimum recommended size for a virtual machine is A3 when using SQL Server Enterprise Edition.
trans-unit.target: The minimum recommended size for a virtual machine is A3 when using SQL Server Enterprise Edition.

trans-unit.source: Select A3 or higher when using SQL Server Enterprise Edition.
trans-unit.target: Select A3 or higher when using SQL Server Enterprise Edition.

trans-unit.source: Select A4 when using SQL Server 2012 or 2014 Enterprise Optimized for Transactional Workloads images.
trans-unit.target: Select A4 when using SQL Server 2012 or 2014 Enterprise Optimized for Transactional Workloads images.

trans-unit.source: Select A7 when using SQL Server 2012 or 2014 Enterprise Optimized for Data Warehousing Workloads images.
trans-unit.target: Select A7 when using SQL Server 2012 or 2014 Enterprise Optimized for Data Warehousing Workloads images.

trans-unit.source: The size selected limits the number of data disks you can configure.
trans-unit.target: The size selected limits the number of data disks you can configure.

trans-unit.source: For most up-to-date information on available virtual machine sizes and the number of data disks that you can attach to a virtual machine, see <linkText>Virtual Machine Sizes for Azure</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For most up-to-date information on available virtual machine sizes and the number of data disks that you can attach to a virtual machine, see <linkText>Virtual Machine Sizes for Azure</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For pricing information, see <linkText>VIrtual Macines Pricing</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For pricing information, see <linkText>VIrtual Macines Pricing</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Click the next arrow on the bottom right to continue.
trans-unit.target: Click the next arrow on the bottom right to continue.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>VM Configuration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>VM Configuration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the second Virtual machine configuration page, configure resources for networking, storage, and availability:
trans-unit.target: On the second Virtual machine configuration page, configure resources for networking, storage, and availability:

trans-unit.source: In the Cloud Service box, choose Create a new cloud service.
trans-unit.target: In the Cloud Service box, choose Create a new cloud service.

trans-unit.source: In the Cloud Service DNS Name box, provide the first portion of a DNS name of your choice, so that it completes a name in the format TESTNAME.cloudapp.net
trans-unit.target: In the Cloud Service DNS Name box, provide the first portion of a DNS name of your choice, so that it completes a name in the format TESTNAME.cloudapp.net

trans-unit.source: In the REGION/AFFINITY GROUP/VIRTUAL NETWORK box, select a region where this virtual image will be hosted.
trans-unit.target: In the REGION/AFFINITY GROUP/VIRTUAL NETWORK box, select a region where this virtual image will be hosted.

trans-unit.source: In the Storage Account, select an existing storage account or select an automatically generated one.
trans-unit.target: In the Storage Account, select an existing storage account or select an automatically generated one.

trans-unit.source: In the AVAILABILITY SET box, select (none).
trans-unit.target: In the AVAILABILITY SET box, select (none).

trans-unit.source: Read and accept the pricing information.
trans-unit.target: Read and accept the pricing information.

trans-unit.source: In the ENDPOINTS section, click in the empty dropdown under NAME, and select MSSQL then type the port number of the instance of the Database Engine (1433 for the default instance).
trans-unit.target: In the ENDPOINTS section, click in the empty dropdown under NAME, and select MSSQL then type the port number of the instance of the Database Engine (1433 for the default instance).

trans-unit.source: Your SQL Server VM can also serve as an IPython Notebook Server, which will be configured in a later step.
trans-unit.target: Your SQL Server VM can also serve as an IPython Notebook Server, which will be configured in a later step.

trans-unit.source: Add a new endpoint to specify the port to use for your IPython Notebook server.
trans-unit.target: Add a new endpoint to specify the port to use for your IPython Notebook server.

trans-unit.source: Enter a name in the NAME column, select a port number of your choice for the public port, and 9999 for the private port.
trans-unit.target: Enter a name in the NAME column, select a port number of your choice for the public port, and 9999 for the private port.

trans-unit.source: Click the next arrow on the bottom right to continue.
trans-unit.target: Click the next arrow on the bottom right to continue.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Select MSSQL and IPython ports</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Select MSSQL and IPython ports</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Accept the default Install VM agent option checked and click the the check mark in the bottom right corner of the wizard to complete the VM provisioning process.
trans-unit.target: Accept the default Install VM agent option checked and click the the check mark in the bottom right corner of the wizard to complete the VM provisioning process.

trans-unit.source: `<linkText>VM Final Options</linkText>
trans-unit.target: `<linkText>VM Final Options</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Wait while Azure prepares your virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Wait while Azure prepares your virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Expect the virtual machine status to proceed through:
trans-unit.target: Expect the virtual machine status to proceed through:

trans-unit.source: Starting (Provisioning)
trans-unit.target: Starting (Provisioning)

trans-unit.source: Stopped
trans-unit.target: Stopped

trans-unit.source: Starting (Provisioning)
trans-unit.target: Starting (Provisioning)

trans-unit.source: Running (Provisioning)
trans-unit.target: Running (Provisioning)

trans-unit.source: Running
trans-unit.target: Running

trans-unit.source: When provisioning completes, click on the name of your virtual machine to go to the DASHBOARD page.
trans-unit.target: When provisioning completes, click on the name of your virtual machine to go to the DASHBOARD page.

trans-unit.source: At the bottom of the page, click Connect.
trans-unit.target: At the bottom of the page, click Connect.

trans-unit.source: Choose to open the rpd file using the Windows Remote Desktop program (%windir%\system32\mstsc.exe).
trans-unit.target: Choose to open the rpd file using the Windows Remote Desktop program (%windir%\system32\mstsc.exe).

trans-unit.source: At the Windows Security dialog box, provide the password for the local administrator account that you specified in an earlier step.
trans-unit.target: At the Windows Security dialog box, provide the password for the local administrator account that you specified in an earlier step.

trans-unit.source: (You might be asked to verify the credentials of the virtual machine.)
trans-unit.target: (You might be asked to verify the credentials of the virtual machine.)

trans-unit.source: The first time you log on to this virtual machine, several processes may need to complete, including setup of your desktop, Windows updates, and completion of the Windows initial configuration tasks (sysprep).
trans-unit.target: The first time you log on to this virtual machine, several processes may need to complete, including setup of your desktop, Windows updates, and completion of the Windows initial configuration tasks (sysprep).

trans-unit.source: After Windows sysprep completes, SQL Server setup completes configuration tasks.
trans-unit.target: After Windows sysprep completes, SQL Server setup completes configuration tasks.

trans-unit.source: These tasks may cause a delay of a few minutes while they complete.
trans-unit.target: These tasks may cause a delay of a few minutes while they complete.

trans-unit.source: SELECT @@SERVERNAME may not return the correct name until SQL Server setup completes, and SQL Server Management Studio may not be visable on the start page.
trans-unit.target: SELECT @@SERVERNAME may not return the correct name until SQL Server setup completes, and SQL Server Management Studio may not be visable on the start page.

trans-unit.source: Once you are connected to the virtual machine with Windows Remote Desktop, the virtual machine works much like any other computer.
trans-unit.target: Once you are connected to the virtual machine with Windows Remote Desktop, the virtual machine works much like any other computer.

trans-unit.source: Connect to the default instance of SQL Server with SQL Server Management Studio (running on the virtual machine) in the normal way.
trans-unit.target: Connect to the default instance of SQL Server with SQL Server Management Studio (running on the virtual machine) in the normal way.

trans-unit.source: To configure your new SQL Server VM to serve as an IPython Notebook server, and install additional supporting tools such AzCopy, Azure Storage Explorer, useful Data Science Python packages, and others, a special customization script is provided to you.
trans-unit.target: To configure your new SQL Server VM to serve as an IPython Notebook server, and install additional supporting tools such AzCopy, Azure Storage Explorer, useful Data Science Python packages, and others, a special customization script is provided to you.

trans-unit.source: To install:
trans-unit.target: To install:

trans-unit.source: Right-click the Windows Start icon and click Command Prompt (Admin)
trans-unit.target: Right-click the Windows Start icon and click Command Prompt (Admin)

trans-unit.source: Copy the following commands and paste at the command prompt.
trans-unit.target: Copy the following commands and paste at the command prompt.

trans-unit.source: When prompted, enter a password of your choice for the IPython Notebook server.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, enter a password of your choice for the IPython Notebook server.

trans-unit.source: The customization script automates several post-install procedures, which include:
trans-unit.target: The customization script automates several post-install procedures, which include:

trans-unit.source: Installation and setup of IPython Notebook server
trans-unit.target: Installation and setup of IPython Notebook server

trans-unit.source: Opening TCP ports in the Windows firewall for the endpoints created earlier:
trans-unit.target: Opening TCP ports in the Windows firewall for the endpoints created earlier:

trans-unit.source: For SQL Server remote connectivity
trans-unit.target: For SQL Server remote connectivity

trans-unit.source: For IPython Notebook server remote connectivity
trans-unit.target: For IPython Notebook server remote connectivity

trans-unit.source: Fetching sample IPython notebooks and SQL scripts
trans-unit.target: Fetching sample IPython notebooks and SQL scripts

trans-unit.source: Downloading and installing useful Data Science Python packages
trans-unit.target: Downloading and installing useful Data Science Python packages

trans-unit.source: Downloading and installing Azure tools such as AzCopy and Azure Storage Explorer
trans-unit.target: Downloading and installing Azure tools such as AzCopy and Azure Storage Explorer

trans-unit.source: You may access and run IPython Notebook from any local or remote browser using a URL of the form https://:, where port is the IPython public port you selected while provisioning the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: You may access and run IPython Notebook from any local or remote browser using a URL of the form https://:, where port is the IPython public port you selected while provisioning the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: IPython Notebook server is running as a background service and will be restarted automatically when you restart the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: IPython Notebook server is running as a background service and will be restarted automatically when you restart the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: If your VM image does not include data disks, i.e., disks other than C drive (OS disk) and D drive (temporary disk), you need to add one or more data disks to store your data.
trans-unit.target: If your VM image does not include data disks, i.e., disks other than C drive (OS disk) and D drive (temporary disk), you need to add one or more data disks to store your data.

trans-unit.source: The VM image for SQL Server 2012 SP2 Enterprise Optimized for DataWarehousing Workloads comes pre-configured with additional disks for SQL Server data and log files.
trans-unit.target: The VM image for SQL Server 2012 SP2 Enterprise Optimized for DataWarehousing Workloads comes pre-configured with additional disks for SQL Server data and log files.

trans-unit.source: Do not use the D drive to store data.
trans-unit.target: Do not use the D drive to store data.

trans-unit.source: As the name implies, it provides temporary storage only.
trans-unit.target: As the name implies, it provides temporary storage only.

trans-unit.source: It offers no redundancy or backup because it doesn't reside in Azure storage.
trans-unit.target: It offers no redundancy or backup because it doesn't reside in Azure storage.

trans-unit.source: To attach additional data disks, follow the steps described in <linkText>How to Attach a Data Disk to a Windows Virtual Machine</linkText><title></title>, which will guide you through:
trans-unit.target: To attach additional data disks, follow the steps described in <linkText>How to Attach a Data Disk to a Windows Virtual Machine</linkText><title></title>, which will guide you through:

trans-unit.source: Attaching empty disk(s) to the virtual machine provisioned in earlier steps
trans-unit.target: Attaching empty disk(s) to the virtual machine provisioned in earlier steps

trans-unit.source: Initialization of the new disk(s) in the virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Initialization of the new disk(s) in the virtual machine

trans-unit.source: The SQL Server Database Engine cannot use Windows Authentication without domain environment.
trans-unit.target: The SQL Server Database Engine cannot use Windows Authentication without domain environment.

trans-unit.source: To connect to the Database Engine from another computer, configure SQL Server for mixed mode authentication.
trans-unit.target: To connect to the Database Engine from another computer, configure SQL Server for mixed mode authentication.

trans-unit.source: Mixed mode authentication allows both SQL Server Authentication and Windows Authentication.
trans-unit.target: Mixed mode authentication allows both SQL Server Authentication and Windows Authentication.

trans-unit.source: SQL authentication mode is required in order to ingest data directly from your SQL Server VM databases in the <linkText>Azure Machine Learning Studio</linkText><title></title> using the Reader module.
trans-unit.target: SQL authentication mode is required in order to ingest data directly from your SQL Server VM databases in the <linkText>Azure Machine Learning Studio</linkText><title></title> using the Reader module.

trans-unit.source: While connected to the virtual machine by using Remote Desktop, use the Windows Search pane and type SQL Server Management Studio (SMSS).
trans-unit.target: While connected to the virtual machine by using Remote Desktop, use the Windows Search pane and type SQL Server Management Studio (SMSS).

trans-unit.source: Click to start the SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS).
trans-unit.target: Click to start the SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS).

trans-unit.source: You may want to add a shortcut to SSMS on your Desktop for future use.
trans-unit.target: You may want to add a shortcut to SSMS on your Desktop for future use.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Start SSMS</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Start SSMS</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The first time you open Management Studio it must create the users Management Studio environment.
trans-unit.target: The first time you open Management Studio it must create the users Management Studio environment.

trans-unit.source: This may take a few moments.
trans-unit.target: This may take a few moments.

trans-unit.source: When opening, Management Studio presents the Connect to Server dialog box.
trans-unit.target: When opening, Management Studio presents the Connect to Server dialog box.

trans-unit.source: In the Server name box, type the name of the virtual machine to connect to the Database Engine with the Object Explorer.
trans-unit.target: In the Server name box, type the name of the virtual machine to connect to the Database Engine with the Object Explorer.

trans-unit.source: (Instead of the virtual machine name you can also use (local) or a single period as the Server name.
trans-unit.target: (Instead of the virtual machine name you can also use (local) or a single period as the Server name.

trans-unit.source: Select Windows Authentication, and leave *your\_VM\_name*\\your\_local\_administrator in the User name box.
trans-unit.target: Select Windows Authentication, and leave *your\_VM\_name*\\your\_local\_administrator in the User name box.

trans-unit.source: Click Connect.
trans-unit.target: Click Connect.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Connect to Server</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Connect to Server</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You may change the SQL Server authentication mode using a Windows registry key change or using the SQL Server Management Studio.
trans-unit.target: You may change the SQL Server authentication mode using a Windows registry key change or using the SQL Server Management Studio.

trans-unit.source: To change authentication mode using the registry key change, start a New Query and execute the following script:
trans-unit.target: To change authentication mode using the registry key change, start a New Query and execute the following script:

trans-unit.source: To change the authentication mode using SQL Server management Studio:
trans-unit.target: To change the authentication mode using SQL Server management Studio:

trans-unit.source: In SQL Server Management Studio Object Explorer, right-click the name of the instance of SQL Server (the virtual machine name), and then click Properties.
trans-unit.target: In SQL Server Management Studio Object Explorer, right-click the name of the instance of SQL Server (the virtual machine name), and then click Properties.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Server Properties</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Server Properties</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Security page, under Server authentication, select SQL Server and Windows Authentication mode, and then click OK.
trans-unit.target: On the Security page, under Server authentication, select SQL Server and Windows Authentication mode, and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Select Authentication Mode</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Select Authentication Mode</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the SQL Server Management Studio dialog box, click OK to acknowledge the requirement to restart SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: In the SQL Server Management Studio dialog box, click OK to acknowledge the requirement to restart SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: In Object Explorer, right-click your server, and then click Restart.
trans-unit.target: In Object Explorer, right-click your server, and then click Restart.

trans-unit.source: (If SQL Server Agent is running, it must also be restarted.)
trans-unit.target: (If SQL Server Agent is running, it must also be restarted.)

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Restart</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Restart</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the SQL Server Management Studio dialog box, click Yes to agree that you want to restart SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: In the SQL Server Management Studio dialog box, click Yes to agree that you want to restart SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: To connect to the Database Engine from another computer, you must create at least one SQL Server authentication login.
trans-unit.target: To connect to the Database Engine from another computer, you must create at least one SQL Server authentication login.

trans-unit.source: You may create new SQL Server logins programmatically or using the SQL Server Management Studio. To create a new sysadmin user with SQL authentication programatically, start a New Query and execute the following script. Replace and with your choice of user name and password. Adjust the password policy as needed (the sample code turns off policy checking and password expiration). For more information about SQL Server logins, see Create a Login.
trans-unit.target: You may create new SQL Server logins programmatically or using the SQL Server Management Studio. To create a new sysadmin user with SQL authentication programatically, start a New Query and execute the following script. Replace and with your choice of user name and password. Adjust the password policy as needed (the sample code turns off policy checking and password expiration). For more information about SQL Server logins, see Create a Login.

trans-unit.source: To create new SQL Server logins using the SQL Server Management Studio:
trans-unit.target: To create new SQL Server logins using the SQL Server Management Studio:

trans-unit.source: In SQL Server Management Studio Object Explorer, expand the folder of the server instance in which you want to create the new login.
trans-unit.target: In SQL Server Management Studio Object Explorer, expand the folder of the server instance in which you want to create the new login.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the Security folder, point to New, and select Login….
trans-unit.target: Right-click the Security folder, point to New, and select Login….

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New Login</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New Login</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Login - New dialog box, on the General page, enter the name of the new user in the Login name box.
trans-unit.target: In the Login - New dialog box, on the General page, enter the name of the new user in the Login name box.

trans-unit.source: Select SQL Server authentication.
trans-unit.target: Select SQL Server authentication.

trans-unit.source: In the Password box, enter a password for the new user.
trans-unit.target: In the Password box, enter a password for the new user.

trans-unit.source: Enter that password again into the Confirm Password box.
trans-unit.target: Enter that password again into the Confirm Password box.

trans-unit.source: To enforce password policy options for complexity and enforcement, select Enforce password policy (recommended).
trans-unit.target: To enforce password policy options for complexity and enforcement, select Enforce password policy (recommended).

trans-unit.source: This is a default option when SQL Server authentication is selected.
trans-unit.target: This is a default option when SQL Server authentication is selected.

trans-unit.source: To enforce password policy options for expiration, select Enforce password expiration (recommended).
trans-unit.target: To enforce password policy options for expiration, select Enforce password expiration (recommended).

trans-unit.source: Enforce password policy must be selected to enable this checkbox.
trans-unit.target: Enforce password policy must be selected to enable this checkbox.

trans-unit.source: This is a default option when SQL Server authentication is selected.
trans-unit.target: This is a default option when SQL Server authentication is selected.

trans-unit.source: To force the user to create a new password after the first time the login is used, select User must change password at next login (Recommended if this login is for someone else to use.
trans-unit.target: To force the user to create a new password after the first time the login is used, select User must change password at next login (Recommended if this login is for someone else to use.

trans-unit.source: If the login is for your own use, do not select this option.)
trans-unit.target: If the login is for your own use, do not select this option.)

trans-unit.source: Enforce password expiration must be selected to enable this checkbox.
trans-unit.target: Enforce password expiration must be selected to enable this checkbox.

trans-unit.source: This is a default option when SQL Server authentication is selected.
trans-unit.target: This is a default option when SQL Server authentication is selected.

trans-unit.source: From the Default database list, select a default database for the login.
trans-unit.target: From the Default database list, select a default database for the login.

trans-unit.source: master is the default for this option.
trans-unit.target: master is the default for this option.

trans-unit.source: If you have not yet created a user database, leave this set to master.
trans-unit.target: If you have not yet created a user database, leave this set to master.

trans-unit.source: In the Default language list, leave default as the value.
trans-unit.target: In the Default language list, leave default as the value.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Login Properties</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Login Properties</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If this is the first login you are creating, you may want to designate this login as a SQL Server administrator.
trans-unit.target: If this is the first login you are creating, you may want to designate this login as a SQL Server administrator.

trans-unit.source: If so, on the Server Roles page, check sysadmin.
trans-unit.target: If so, on the Server Roles page, check sysadmin.

trans-unit.source: Security Note: Members of the sysadmin fixed server role have complete control of the Database Engine.
trans-unit.target: Security Note: Members of the sysadmin fixed server role have complete control of the Database Engine.

trans-unit.source: You should carefully restrict membership in this role.
trans-unit.target: You should carefully restrict membership in this role.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>sysadmin</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>sysadmin</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click OK.
trans-unit.target: Click OK.

trans-unit.source: To connect to the SQL Server Database Engine from another computer, you must know the Domain Name System (DNS) name of the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: To connect to the SQL Server Database Engine from another computer, you must know the Domain Name System (DNS) name of the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: (This is the name the internet uses to identify the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: (This is the name the internet uses to identify the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: You can use the IP address, but the IP address might change when Azure moves resources for redundancy or maintenance.
trans-unit.target: You can use the IP address, but the IP address might change when Azure moves resources for redundancy or maintenance.

trans-unit.source: The DNS name will be stable because it can be redirected to a new IP address.)
trans-unit.target: The DNS name will be stable because it can be redirected to a new IP address.)

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal (or from the previous step), select VIRTUAL MACHINES.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal (or from the previous step), select VIRTUAL MACHINES.

trans-unit.source: On the VIRTUAL MACHINE INSTANCES page, in the DNS NAME column, find and copy the DNS name for the virtual machine which appears preceded by http://.
trans-unit.target: On the VIRTUAL MACHINE INSTANCES page, in the DNS NAME column, find and copy the DNS name for the virtual machine which appears preceded by http://.

trans-unit.source: (The user interface might not display the entire name, but you can right-click on it, and select copy.)
trans-unit.target: (The user interface might not display the entire name, but you can right-click on it, and select copy.)

trans-unit.source: On a computer connected to the internet, open SQL Server Management Studio.
trans-unit.target: On a computer connected to the internet, open SQL Server Management Studio.

trans-unit.source: In the Connect to Server or Connect to Database Engine dialog box, in the Server name box, enter the DNS name of the virtual machine (determined in the previous task) and a public endpoint port number in the format of DNSName,portnumber such as tutorialtestVM.cloudapp.net,57500.
trans-unit.target: In the Connect to Server or Connect to Database Engine dialog box, in the Server name box, enter the DNS name of the virtual machine (determined in the previous task) and a public endpoint port number in the format of DNSName,portnumber such as tutorialtestVM.cloudapp.net,57500.

trans-unit.source: In the Authentication box, select SQL Server Authentication.
trans-unit.target: In the Authentication box, select SQL Server Authentication.

trans-unit.source: In the Login box, type the name of a login that you created in an earlier task.
trans-unit.target: In the Login box, type the name of a login that you created in an earlier task.

trans-unit.source: In the Password box, type the password of the login that you create in an earlier task.
trans-unit.target: In the Password box, type the password of the login that you create in an earlier task.

trans-unit.source: Click Connect.
trans-unit.target: Click Connect.

trans-unit.source: In later stages of the Advanced Analytics Process and Technology, you will use the <linkText>Azure Machine Learning Studio</linkText><title></title> to build and deploy machine learning models.
trans-unit.target: In later stages of the Advanced Analytics Process and Technology, you will use the <linkText>Azure Machine Learning Studio</linkText><title></title> to build and deploy machine learning models.

trans-unit.source: To ingest data from your SQL Server VM databases directly into Azure Machine Learning for training or scoring, use the Reader module in a new <linkText>Azure Machine Learning Studio</linkText><title></title> experiment.
trans-unit.target: To ingest data from your SQL Server VM databases directly into Azure Machine Learning for training or scoring, use the Reader module in a new <linkText>Azure Machine Learning Studio</linkText><title></title> experiment.

trans-unit.source: This topic is covered in more details through the Advanced Analytics Process and Technology guide links.
trans-unit.target: This topic is covered in more details through the Advanced Analytics Process and Technology guide links.

trans-unit.source: For an introduction, see <linkText>What is Azure Machine Learning Studio?</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For an introduction, see <linkText>What is Azure Machine Learning Studio?</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In the Properties pane of the Reader module, select Azure SQL Database from the Data Source dropdown list.
trans-unit.target: In the Properties pane of the Reader module, select Azure SQL Database from the Data Source dropdown list.

trans-unit.source: In the Database server name text box, enter tcp:,1433
trans-unit.target: In the Database server name text box, enter tcp:,1433

trans-unit.source: Enter the SQL user name in the Server user account name text box.
trans-unit.target: Enter the SQL user name in the Server user account name text box.

trans-unit.source: Enter the sql user's password in the Server user account password text box.
trans-unit.target: Enter the sql user's password in the Server user account password text box.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure ML Reader</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure ML Reader</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Azure Virtual Machines are priced as pay only for what you use.
trans-unit.target: Azure Virtual Machines are priced as pay only for what you use.

trans-unit.source: To ensure that you are not being billed when not using your virtual machine, it has to be in the Stopped (Deallocated) state.
trans-unit.target: To ensure that you are not being billed when not using your virtual machine, it has to be in the Stopped (Deallocated) state.

trans-unit.source: Shutting down the virtual machine from inside (using Windows power options), the VM is stopped but remains allocated.
trans-unit.target: Shutting down the virtual machine from inside (using Windows power options), the VM is stopped but remains allocated.

trans-unit.source: To ensure you’re not being billed, always stop virtual machines from the <linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To ensure you’re not being billed, always stop virtual machines from the <linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You can also stop the VM through Powershell by calling ShutdownRoleOperation with "PostShutdownAction" equal to "StoppedDeallocated".
trans-unit.target: You can also stop the VM through Powershell by calling ShutdownRoleOperation with "PostShutdownAction" equal to "StoppedDeallocated".

trans-unit.source: To shutdown and deallocate the virtual machine:
trans-unit.target: To shutdown and deallocate the virtual machine:

trans-unit.source: Log in to the <linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title> using your account.
trans-unit.target: Log in to the <linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title> using your account.

trans-unit.source: Select VIRTUAL MACHINES from the left navigation bar.
trans-unit.target: Select VIRTUAL MACHINES from the left navigation bar.

trans-unit.source: In the list of virtual machines, click on the name of your virtual machine then go to the DASHBOARD page.
trans-unit.target: In the list of virtual machines, click on the name of your virtual machine then go to the DASHBOARD page.

trans-unit.source: At the bottom of the page, click SHUTDOWN.
trans-unit.target: At the bottom of the page, click SHUTDOWN.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>VM Shutdown</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>VM Shutdown</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The virtual machine will be deallocated but not deleted.
trans-unit.target: The virtual machine will be deallocated but not deleted.

trans-unit.source: You may restart your virtual machine at any time from the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: You may restart your virtual machine at any time from the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Your virtual machine is now ready to use in your data science exercises.
trans-unit.target: Your virtual machine is now ready to use in your data science exercises.

trans-unit.source: The virtual machine is also ready for use as an IPython Notebook server for the exploration and processing of data, and other tasks in conjunction with Azure Machine Learning and the Advanced Analytics Process and Technology (ADAPT).
trans-unit.target: The virtual machine is also ready for use as an IPython Notebook server for the exploration and processing of data, and other tasks in conjunction with Azure Machine Learning and the Advanced Analytics Process and Technology (ADAPT).

trans-unit.source: The next steps in the data science process are mapped in the <linkText>Learning Guide: Advanced data processing in Azure</linkText><title></title> and may include steps that move data into HDInsight, process and sample it there in preparation for learning from the data with Azure Machine Learning.
trans-unit.target: The next steps in the data science process are mapped in the <linkText>Learning Guide: Advanced data processing in Azure</linkText><title></title> and may include steps that move data into HDInsight, process and sample it there in preparation for learning from the data with Azure Machine Learning.
